name: Pol Roti
description: A traditional Sri Lankan coconut flatbread, perfect for a hearty and healthy breakfast.
instructions: Mix flour, coconut, and salt in a bowl.
Add water gradually to form a soft dough.
Divide into small balls and roll into flatbreads.
Cook on a hot griddle with coconut oil until golden on both sides.

name: Gotukola Sambol
description: A vibrant, nutrient-packed Sri Lankan salad with gotukola (pennywort), rich in vitamins.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh gotukola leaves, finely chopped
instructions: Wash and finely chop gotukola leaves.
Mix gotukola, coconut, onion, and chili in a bowl.
Add lime juice and salt, then toss well.
Serve fresh as a side with rice or roti.

name: Fish Ambul Thiyal
description: A tangy and spicy Sri Lankan fish curry, cooked with goraka for a healthy, flavorful meal.
instructions: Soak goraka in warm water for 10 minutes, then blend into a paste.
Marinate fish with goraka paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat coconut oil, saut√© curry leaves and onion until golden.
Add marinated fish and cook on low heat for 15 minutes until dry and aromatic.

name: Kiri Pani
description: A refreshing Sri Lankan yogurt dessert with treacle, perfect for a healthy sweet treat.
instructions: In a bowl, whisk yogurt until smooth.
Add kithul treacle and cardamom, mixing well.
Top with banana slices and chopped cashews.
Chill for 10 minutes and serve as a snack or dessert.
